intro: Cheiranthus varius, commonly known as the variable honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other familiar plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruit is a long, slender pod that splits open to release the seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
